author: Glen - DIY Creators
title: Outdoor Modern Chair
description: Turning inexpensive lumber into a beautiful Modern outdoor chair.

author: Glen - DIY Creators
title: Wall Mounted Dream Desk
description: This is the perfect dream desk for anyone looking to save space in a stylish fashion. This is a wall mounted with a few built-in items. Starting with the back panel this is mounted to the wall with the French cleat system and wrapped with RF LED strip controlled by a remote. To the left corner, there’s a drink holder. In the middle section of the desk, there is an integrated power outlet with two USB ports. To the right of that, there’s a small desk grommet to pass wires through giving the desk a clean look. As a way to stay wire-free, there is a hidden wireless charger. The bottom is removable so if any electronics ever fail you can easily replace it. Last but not least, the desk is designed as a two-part system to easily break down and transport.

author: Glen - DIY Creators
title: How To Make A Mid-Century, Modern Accent Table
description: This mid-century modern accent table is a very simple design, but looks great and has storage space available. It works well as a place to put a TV in a bedroom, or as an accent table in any room.
materials: Table: (2) Top and Bottom = 39.5 x 14 inches

author: Glen - DIY Creators
title: HOW TO MAKE A MOTORIZED COFFEE TABLE WITH A SECRET COMPARTMENT
description: Amazing Coffee table with a motorized secret compartment. Great way to hide things in plain sight.
materials: (4) Furniture Cabinet Metal Legs Corner feet Stainless Steel Chrome Polish
(2) Heavy Duty 15 lb High Rise Cabinet Magnetic Catch, White/Nickel Cabinet Door Magnet
Wood 16 Inches x 6.5 Feet Vinyl Sheet Film Textured Finish (Unicorn White Wood)
20 inch Heavy Duty 250 lb Steel Drawer Slides - 3/4 inch Wide - Full Extension with Over Travel

author: Glen - DIY Creators
title: DIY Rustic Bookshelf And Storage
description: DIY Bookshelf - Storage & Organization
materials: Threaded insert - 30pcs 15mm Furniture Screw-in Nut Carbon Steel Color Zinc Plated Bolt Fastener Connector Hex Socket Drive Threaded Insert Nuts for Wood Furniture Assortment 1/4 inches
Connecting bolt - Fastener 14973445775 Connector Bolt, 1/4 inches-20 x 1.97, Black
Connecting bolt (Cross support intersection) - Fastener 014973445713 Joint Connector Bolts, 1/4-20 x 1.18, Piece-10,Black
Espresso Stain - Espresso Interior Oil Based Wood Finish Stain 7995806
Danish oil - Watco 65551 Danish Oil Wood Finish, Pint, Light Walnut
Bracket - 20-Pack 3/4 inch Corner Brace, 304 Stainless Steel, Brushed Finish, Right Angle Brackets with Screws for Wood Furniture
Dowel Pins - 840014 1/4-Inch Fluted Wood Dowel Pins, 72-Pack

author: Glen - DIY Creators
title: How To Build A Portable Pallet Wall
description: A double side movable wall.
materials: (4) 2 in. Soft Rubber Swivel Plate Caster with 90 lbs. Load Rating and Side Brake
(32) 1/4 in. x 1 in. Hex Zinc Plated Lag Screw
24 ft White & Multicolor (RGB+W) Indoor/Outdoor LED Tape Light w/Remote
16 ft. White Indoor LED Tape Light w/remote (Plug-in or direct wire)

author: Glen - DIY Creators
title: DIY Platform Bed With Floating Night Stands
description: This DIY Platform Bed with Floating Nightstands has everything you need to enhance your bedroom. The LED light strip along the back of the ample headboard offers a luxurious feel, the floating nightstands provide storage and hidden electrical outlets with ports to charge your devices. This clean, modern design delivers both sophistication and comfort.
materials: ( 16) 2 by 8 Lumber (headboard, bed frame and bed trim)
(1) sheet or 3/4in (19.05mm) plywood a small piece
(4 packs) Corner brace (outside of the bed trim and inside bed foot)
(2 packs) Corner brace (inside the bed trim )
L- brackets for the bed frame
22 gauge wire (for the puck light switch)

author: Glen - DIY Creators
title: Modern Outdoor Chair
description: This Modern 2 by 4 Chair is an attractive seating solution that offers a tasteful accent to any room. It has an angled seat for comfort and can be used with or without cushions. The seat is suspended by two bolts on each side. The arms were painted with an interior-exterior white paint and the seat was stained with a warm hickory finish. As always, you can choose a finish that best suits your taste. This chair’s impressive silhouette can be easily broken down and stored.
materials: (50) 3 in wood screws (legs, seat, back, and side)

author: Glen - DIY Creators
title: DIY FAUX LIVE EDGE MIRROR
description: We all know how awesome live edge furniture looks, sadly everything comes at a cost, and since I make a lot of stuff I need to watch my budget. Though this may not be a true live edge, with a little creativity you can create an awesome faux live edge piece. Even if you don’t need a mirror this faux live edge concept can be applied to almost any project you would like to make.

author: Glen - DIY Creators
title: THE CONTOUR DESK LAMP
description: This Contour Desk Lamp offers style and function and would be a lovely addition to your den, living room, office or bedroom. The simple design is paired with a clean natural wood finish that complements any decor. This lamp is made from plywood, wrapped with iron-on veneer, and uses an LED puck light. It’s also equipped with a toggle switch to control lighting easily and a cool mahogany lamp base.
materials: LED Under Cabinet Lighting Fixtures, Puck Lights Kit, 1020 Lumens, 3000K Warm White
24410 24410 Paper Back Real Wood Veneer Facing, 24 inches x 48 inches, Red Oak
2:1 Heat Shrink Tubing Tube Sleeving Wire Cable 8 Sizes 2-13mm Black
AC 250V 6A 2 Pin ON/Off I/O SPST Snap in Mini Boat Rocker Switch
Adapter Power Supply - 12V DC 2A, 5.5mm - 2.1mm UL Listed
(1/2 Sheet) of 3/4 in. Oak  plywood – Lamp Frame

author: Divas Can Cook
title: How To Make Hot Pizza Dip
description: This hot pizza dip is a hit with adults and kids alike! It packs all that yummy, hot cheesy goodness of a pizza but in a fun dip form. Serve this pizza dip fresh out of the oven with toasted garlic baguettes.

author: Divas Can Cook
title: How To Make CAKE POPS
description: Learn how to make cake pops that have the perfect texture, easy to make, and pretty darn fun!!
materials: Chocolate Cake, prepared (I used ½ of a 9x13 devils food box cake)
Chocolate Frosting (amount depends on moistness of cake. I used two big spoonfuls. See video)
2 boxes Premium white chocolate ( I used Baker's brand) *update* I now use candy melts

author: Divas Can Cook
title: How to Make The BEST Easy Lasagna Soup
description: Easy Lasagna Soup that the whole family will love! Full of beef, noodles, tomatoes, onions, garlic, fresh herbs and lots of cheese!
materials: 14.5 oz canned diced tomatoes (I used basil, oregano, garlic kind)

author: Divas Can Cook
title: How to Make Roast Beef and Cheddar Sliders
description: Small but mighty!! Bring on the party sandwiches!! These roast beef and cheddar sliders are easy, quick and so delicious! If BBQ drenched roast beef, smokey cheddar and potato buns brushed in a tangy poppy butter sounds like your jam, then make these ASAP!!  Serve piping hot and watch them disappear!
materials: 2 (7 oz) packs thinly sliced roast beef (24 slices)
1 cup BBQ sauce (I use Original Sweet Baby Rays)

author: Divas Can Cook
title: How To Make Country Fried Chicken Tenders
description: Crispy, rustic, country fried chicken tenders! Soaked in seasoned buttermilk for a super tender and juicy texture and coated in a flavorful flour coating! These chicken tenders seriously don't need a dipping sauce.
materials: 1.5 pound chicken tenderloins or chicken breast cut into strips across the grain

author: Divas Can Cook
title: Cheesy Chicken Spaghetti!
description: Creamy, cheesy chicken spaghetti is the perfect meal to change up spaghetti night! This dish is so easy! It’s also simple to change up the add-ins to please the entire family! We’re making this from scratch today so no need to pull out those cans of cream-of-stuff soup! This homemade cheese sauce is so flavorful with all of the peppers, onions, garlic, and celery! Complete the meal with a salad and garlic bread! Oh and of course, sweet ice tea!
materials: 2 cups seasoned chicken breast chopped & cooked
8 oz spaghetti cooked al dente according to packaged
⅔ cups red bell pepper, diced (about ½ red bell pepper)
⅔ cup celery, finely diced (about 3 celery sticks)
⅔ cup white onion, diced (about ½ small onion)
2½ cups sharp cheddar cheese, shredded (can use a variety of cheeses)
salt, black pepper, garlic powder & onion powder to season

author: Divas Can Cook
title: Buffalo Cauliflower Wings (Vegan)
description: Looking for an appetizer that will satisfy your vegan and non-vegan friends? Try these delicious vegan buffalo cauliflower “wings”! They are breaded, tossed in buffalo sauce, and baked until nice and crisp! These babies go fast and are so flavorful! Serve with carrots and celery sticks and ranch/blue cheese dressing for dipping!
materials: 5 oz vegan seasoned croutons, crushed into fine crumbs (I used Fresh Gourmet Organics Seasoned brand)
1/2 cup vegan eggs ( I used Just Egg brand)
1/2 cup buffalo sauce ( I used Texas Pete brand)
1/4 cup vegan butter, melted ( I used Earth Balance brand)

author: Divas Can Cook
title: Fried SWEET POTATO Hand Pies!!
description: Calling all sweet potato pie fans!!!  Creamy, spiced sweet potato pie filling stuffed in a homemade buttery pie crust and finished off with a crackling vanilla glaze. These fried sweet potato hand pies are my new fav! Pile these babies high on a platter and watch them disappear!!
materials: 2 cups fresh sweet potatoes cooked & mashed (about 3 small sweet potatoes)

author: Divas Can Cook
title: Homemade Coconut Pound Cake
description: Moist & tender homemade coconut pound cake! There is nothing like this heavenly coconut pound cake fresh from the oven with a side of coffee, mercy! Made from scratch, with simple ingredients. If you're a coconut fan you're gonna love the simplicity and perfectly balanced coconut flavor of this pound cake! It gets even better the next day!

author: Divas Can Cook
title: Creamy Baked Macaroni & Cheese
description: It’s baked macaroni and cheese time! Because seriously, who can have too many delicious baked macaroni and cheese recipes????( This is my husband's favorite. Yep even over my sisters mac n cheese that he loves so much!)  This recipe is the love child of the two fan-favorited baked macaroni and cheese recipes on my site!  It’s super creamy, cheesy and so delicious! It’s the perfect middle ground for kids who love creamy mac n cheese and adults who love that baked, old-fashioned taste of southern, soul-food style mac n cheese. This baked macaroni and cheese recipe doesn’t use velveeta, just simple ingredients! You’ll also love that it only uses colby-jack and smoked cheddar instead of several different varieties (which can get pretty expensive).
materials: 3 1/2 cups Colby Jack cheese shredded & divided
1/2 cup Smoked Cheddar cheese shredded & divided

author: Thuy Dao
title: Balcony Vegetable Garden
description: My rental apartment has only a quite small balcony which is usually empty and scorching hot when summer comes. But not this year. I have embarked on the journey to turn my balcony into a green haven. After a few months I realized that to nurture a garden is to feed not just the body, but the soul.

author: CaliKim
title: Seed Starting
description: Spring air smells like possibility. Don’t you think? There’s just something about the lengthening daylight and the scent of fragile green grass wafting through the air on a sunny spring afternoon that gives me goosebumps. So many possibilities. So many projects. So many ideas and dreams floating through my head. It’s the homesteading equivalent of a blank slate. It makes me feel like a brand-new homesteader with stars in my eyes all over again. But there’s one part of spring planning that’s always bugged me a bit. Starting seeds.

author: Huw Richards
title: Permaculture Garden
description: This video is of Tim and Maddy Harland's beautiful no dig permaculture kitchen garden in Hapmshire UK. Tim and Maddy are the founders of the fantastic @Permaculture Magazine​ and have a tranquil vegetable garden, meadow and food forest at their home that has been maturing for 25 years! I hope that this is a prime example of what can be achieved in a relatively small space, and that you don't always have to follow the norms when it comes to growing your own food. No dig gardening is a wonderful method of growing food as it brings a whole host of benefits. Not only are you saving time and effort in the garden, you're also improving the health of your soil and as a result, the health of your plants. I love the geometry that Maddy and Tim have with their triangle shaped raised beds, as well as a big emphasis on vertical gardening and permaculture principles.
materials: Straw bales or lucerne (alfalfa hay) bales or both

author: Roots & Refuge Farm
title: Vertical Gardening
description: So many people dismiss growing vertically in their garden assuming it isn't worth the cost or effort. Today I'm telling you, from my experience, the many benefits of vertical gardening, how to do it cheaply, and what you can grow!

author: Geeks of Green
title: Water Propagation
description: I love water propagation of cuttings, mainly for the sheer joy of watching the roots grow so I spy keep putting cuttings in water. I have observed  over time that there are a few mistakes we tend to make that can be easily avoided. Check this video to know what are those mistakes and how to avoid them,  making all your water propagating adventures a happy success!

author: Urban Gardening
title: Balcony Vegetable Garden
description: Composting is a great project to do because it uses food and yard scraps that would otherwise be thrown away to make a nutrient-rich soil amendment.Making compost correctly will allow you to feed your plants essential nutrients and make your soil more fertile, all while using items that would otherwise go into your trash.

author: Gardening at 58 North
title: Basil!
description: In this video I demonstrate how quickly you can go from one Basil plant to an almost infinite supply. I go from one plant to 8 in 30 days and then to 18 in 60 days. In one year using this method you could have thousands of Basil plants all from the original mother plant. I use time-lapse photography to document the growth at every stage.Basil propagates very easily from cuttings and within a month those cuttings are established plants which can then be used to take more cuttings. At each stage of making new plants there are always plenty of leaves which can be used for cooking. Once you get enough plants to provide for your needs you can stop taking cuttings and just harvest the stems as you need them.

author: Urban Gardening
title: Tomatoes!
description: Growing tomatoes is often the impetus for starting a vegetable garden, and every tomato lover dreams of growing the ultimate tomato: firm but juicy, sweet but tangy, aromatic, and blemish free. Unfortunately, there are few vegetables that are prone to more problems than tomatoes. The trick to growing great-tasting tomatoes is to choose the best varieties, start the plants off right, and control problems before they happen. Start here with some time-tested tomato growing tips to ensure your tomato bragging rights this year.

author: Epic Gardening
title: Ginger!
description: Growing ginger is a rewarding experience as it's such a versatile plant for use in the kitchen...and shockingly easy to do! We're growing ginger in containers from store-bought ginger and talking about planting ginger to increase both the size and speed of your harvest.

author: Epic Gardening
title: Peppers!
description: Growing peppers is extremely rewarding due to the sheer variety of flavor, shapes, sizes, and colors. There's something for everyone! But there are some unique mistakes you can make when learning how to grow peppers that can hamper your success. We discuss 5 of them in today's video.

author: Hilary, Tiny Hell on Wheels
title: Glitter Countertops
description: It’s a nice surprise when you go over to the cabinet to make a drink, and BAM! There’s a glitter countertop! Talk about a conversation starter! Use an epoxy resin with glitter stirred in to give the countertop a durable finish with a transfixing, dimensional sparkle to it.
materials: Glitter-8oz. Jar of Silver Glitter from Sulyn
One Pound Iridescent Glitter from Spectra
Holographic Star Glitter Confetti from Miki Sin

author: Dave the Wood Worker
title: Hanging Wooden Pot Rack
description: Chefs rely on overhead racks like this one to keep cookware organized and within easy reach. If you’re tired of opening your kitchen cabinets, only to have a stack of pots and pans tumble out, it’s time to invest in a pot rack. Not only do pot racks help to organize all your cookware, but they'll also keep your pots and pans in better conditions, as stacking them can lead to scratches and dings.
materials: Paint or Stain of your choice

author: Amy Howard
title: Faux Marble Kitchen Backsplash
description: A backsplash may seem like a small detail, but it's often the focal point of the kitchen. And marble—especially slabs featuring dramatic veining—acts like a piece of art. Not only will it help protect from food splatters, but the backdrop is what most people will comment on when they see a new kitchen design. Whether you decide to incorporate a backsplash that goes from the countertop to the hood or straight up to the ceiling is up to you—either way, you can't go wrong. Another reason we love marble is it has the most stunning natural color palette: subtle neutrals of white, creams, grays, and gold. These earth tones will never look dated.
materials: Good Man is Hard to Find - One Step Paint

author: Francois et moi
title: Pour-over Coffee Stand
description: A pour over coffee has a clarity of flavor that's hard to attain from an electric drip coffeemaker. But for some, the mechanized version's lure of convenience is just too strong. Here, have a stylish alternative to the drip coffeemaker.
materials: Target Wood Pole Desk Lamp-base only
Hario V60 glass coffee dripper with removable Red plastic base holder and handle
Rustoleum White Appliance Epoxy spray paint

author: Ben Schmanke
title: Kitchen Cart on Wheels
description: Kitchen carts are convenient and provide additional storage space for your kitchen. ... Kitchen carts are also ideal for people with small kitchens, because they don't take up valuable floor space, and they add extra counter space for preparing a meal.
materials: 1in x 27-½in x 55in butcher block top or similar
4 - ¼in x ¾in x 17in screen bead to cover shelf edges

author: Colleen, Lemon Thistle
title: Pull Out Shelf for Appliance Garage
description: Add a simple DIY pull out shelf to your cabinets with this tutorial. This is used for an appliance garage to be able to use small appliances without removing them from the cupboard.
materials: Wood board cut to fit space- can be scrap

author: Jenny, Shakeys Pizza Parlor
title: Sparkle Cake Stand
description: The tall cake stand is primarily used at large events with many people. Tall cake stands of different heights and shapes add drama and interest in the visual presentation of food. Food displayed on the tall cake stands contains not only cakes but also small finger food and other small pasties usually in strong contrasting colour to add interest in the presentation of food.

author: Stalara Craft
title: Gold & Glitter Dipped Champagne Glasses
description: The idea for glitter dipped champagne flutes or wine glasses came from New Years. It's cheap, easy and makes a great New Years party gift for guests! These glasses are a statement piece and can really be used for any celebration. These will talked about long after the ball drops!

author: Tan, Squirrelly Minds
title: Copper Piper Paper Towel Holder
description: Copper details and accessories are on trend right now in interior design, and if you love this look, you’re going to love this DIY copper hanging paper towel holder. Actually, you could modify this to be a toilet paper roll holder in the bathroom as well, or a kitchen garbage bag roll holder.

author: DIY Huntress
title: Folding Step Stool
description: This project is SERIOUSLY simple to make! In fact, if you consider yourself to be a beginner woodworker, then this project is perfect for you. Even better, if you are short on space or, just short. This step stool is easy to hang on a pegboard when not in use. Ready to see how it’s done?

author: Cristina Ramirez
title: Jewelry Dish
description: I love the little trays, bowls and objects from places like Anthropologie, Urban Outfitters, West Elm etc. and took some of their designs as inspiration.  I love how simple this DIY is and you can really personalize these dishes to your own personality or to friends.

author: Florian Gadsby
title: Stoneware Bowl
description: Here's my I make a medium stoneware bowl, from the very beginning as a lump of soft clay to the finished, fired vessel. There's a steps, from throwing, turning, bisque firing, waxing, glazing and lastly reduction firing.

author: Peaceful Cuisine
title: Kohiki Plate
description: Kohiki is a traditional style of pottery with a rich history in the Asian continent. Kohiki has a long history in Japan and is now part of several cultures around the world. It has a shiny dark clay body covered in porcelain, as is famous in pots and teacups that emanate from Japan.

author: Amil Ceramics
title: Ceramic Planters
description: Plants are a great way to liven up your indoor decor. Creative pots and other plant vessels bring out more of your style, and DIY planters are an even greater way to add a personal touch to your home. These easy, simple ceramic planters are a great beginner project and can be customized in any color.

author: Lolita Olympia
title: Ceramic Mug
description: eeeeeek!!! this video has been in the making for SO LONG now and i am so excited to finally be sharing it. I know you guys love my pottery content so as requested here is a tutorial on how i make my mugs from home! Please note i am self taught - and am just sharing what I DO - in no means am i saying this is the 'right' or 'correct' way to do things, it is purely just what works for me and i hope some of you find it some what helpful!

author: Jescia Hopper
title: Ceramics 101
description: This video covers some of the primary vocabulary about ceramics, including wedging and recycling clay, handbuilding processes, and firing methods. Check out my other ceramics videos for tips on stages of clay, tools, and handbuilding techniques!

author: Stereokroma
title: Stoneware Teapot
description: Ronald Pothier is a potter having started all the way back in 1973 at only the age 13! Today, he works out of his studio in Hemmingford, Quebec where he produces beautiful ceramic pieces of art. Bowls, plates, cups, vases, teapots and more, they are strong and practical for everyday use in your kitchen. Watch as Ronald throws two different teapot designs with such confidence and ease. He makes it look easy but throwing clay on a wheel is quite the workout while also requiring a fine level of finesse. Later on, Ronald explains how he fires, decorates and glazes his pottery and then we see the final result of all the hard work. It's a multistage process that takes several weeks to complete and decades of experience to perfect.

author: Eater
title: Ceramic Plates
description: On this episode of Handmade, ceramicist Jono Pandolfi shows us how his team makes 300 handcrafted plates, mugs, cups, and other dinnerware for some of America’s best restaurants. Eater is the one-stop-shop for food and restaurant obsessives across the country. With features, explainers, animations, recipes, and more — it’s the most indulgent food content around. So get hungry.

author: Matt Horne Pottery
title: Round Bellied Vase
description: I am a self employed potter, based in West Hythe, Kent (UK), and I have been working with crystalline glazes since 2009. All of my crystalline ceramics are hand thrown in porcelain, and I always enjoy experimenting with throwing challenging shapes and glazing with new colour combinations to produce exciting, contemporary work. You can find a selection of my work available for sale on my buy online page, while I also supply a number of galleries, and I regularly exhibit at shows across the UK. I can ship my work worldwide, so if you are a gallery or outlet interested in stocking my work please get in touch.

author: Offgrid Secrets
title: Making Clay
description: In this short video I show you how to make clay from dirt. The process is very simple and only takes about a day to get an end result. To increase your chances of making the most clay, try to start with dirt you believe contains a high amount of clay, but you could try this with any dirt, most of the time there will be some clay in there. After your done making your clay it can be used for pottery, ceramics, molding, crafting, sculpting, Terracotta, earthenware, arts and crafts and more. Knowing how to make your own homemade clay for free is an essential bushcraft survival skill. Knowing this primitive technology allows you to process clay ready for a Kiln.  This natural method for making clay from dirt should be common knowledge.

author: DIY with Adi
title: Book Lamp
description: You can use it as atmosphere light, desk lamp, floor lamp, wall lamp, nightlight, droplight, outdoor light, emergency light etc. Warm Yellow Light gives great help to people to get into sleep.

author: Home Made Simple
title: Branch Chandelier
description: Bring a bit of the outdoors into your home. The twisted branches of this beautiful light fixture are suspended by four vertical branches that converge at the apex of the piece.

author: Kitty's Kreations Boutique
title: Tiki Wine Bottle Torch
description: For those of you who are wine connoisseurs, this may give you another reason to have an extra glass or two at the end of the night but don’t get too carried away. You don’t need to be able to send the Batman signal from your backyard!

author: Superholly
title: Cloud Lamp
description: Want to know exactly what it's gonna take to make your very own cloud lamp? Here are ALL the logistics! Check it out, follow along, and you'll be enjoying sunsets inside your bedroom in no time!

author: Craig Kohlruss
title: Flower Pot Fire Pit
description: Outdoor propane fire pits sold at patio furniture stores can be expensive, and wood-burning ones are bad for our air quality. But if you’re handy with a few simple tools, you can build a cleaner-burning propane fire pit for a lot less money in a snap.

author: Mernards
title: Geometric Copper Pendant Light Fixture
description: Hang this unique and artsy copper light fixture to show off your creativity! A copper geometric shape displays a striking design and features a warm golden glow. This pendant light is the perfect addition for a reading nook or lounging area.

author: Tiffany Bui
title: Neon Sign
description: Neon signs are cool, but they can be fragile and expensive if you need a custom design. If you'd rather make your own on the cheap, you can use EL wire, and some simple plastic tubing.

author: RCLifeOn
title: Acrylic LED Sign
description: I'm thrilled to introduce you to the world of engraved acrylic. By using our homemade engraving tool, we can engrave basically any shapes on a piece of clear acrylic. By using powerful LED lights the image, numbers or letters will light up.

author: The DIY Crab
title: Infinity Coffee Table
description: Turn on the lights inside this table and you'll be staring into infinity. This project is easy to build, but makes a dramatic impact when the lights inside it go on.

author: Jessyratfink
title: Action Figure Lamp
description: This action figure lamp is a fairly quick and cheap project, and I love that the results are so dramatic with so little effort! Plus, it will be nice to have some geeky things around presented in a nicer fashion. All I've got left as far as action figures are some Cowboy Bebop and Mouse Guard ones.
